mn8:4.4.pli: Na kho panete, cunda, ariyassa vinaye sallekhā vuccanti.
mn8:4.4.en: But in the training of the Noble One these are not called ‘self-effacement’;

mn8:5.4.pli: Na kho panete, cunda, ariyassa vinaye sallekhā vuccanti.
mn8:5.4.en: But in the training of the Noble One these are not called ‘self-effacement’;

mn8:6.4.pli: Na kho panete, cunda, ariyassa vinaye sallekhā vuccanti.
mn8:6.4.en: But in the training of the Noble One these are not called ‘self-effacement’;

mn8:7.4.pli: Na kho panete, cunda, ariyassa vinaye sallekhā vuccanti.
mn8:7.4.en: But in the training of the Noble One these are not called ‘self-effacement’;

mn8:8.4.pli: Na kho panete, cunda, ariyassa vinaye sallekhā vuccanti.
mn8:8.4.en: But in the training of the Noble One these are not called ‘self-effacement’;

mn8:9.4.pli: Na kho panete, cunda, ariyassa vinaye sallekhā vuccanti.
mn8:9.4.en: But in the training of the Noble One these are not called ‘self-effacement’;

mn8:10.4.pli: Na kho panete, cunda, ariyassa vinaye sallekhā vuccanti.
mn8:10.4.en: But in the training of the Noble One these are not called ‘self-effacement’;

mn8:11.4.pli: Na kho panete, cunda, ariyassa vinaye sallekhā vuccanti.
mn8:11.4.en: But in the training of the Noble One these are not called ‘self-effacement’;

mn8:12.1.pli: Idha kho pana vo, cunda, sallekho karaṇīyo.
mn8:12.1.en: Now, Cunda, you should work on self-effacement in each of the following ways.

mn8:17.1.pli: Iti kho, cunda, desito mayā sallekhapariyāyo, desito cittuppādapariyāyo, desito parikkamanapariyāyo, desito uparibhāgapariyāyo, desito parinibbānapariyāyo.
mn8:17.1.en: So, Cunda, I’ve taught the expositions by way of self-effacement, arising of thought, bypassing, going up, and extinguishing.

dn28:20.2.pli: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, tathāgatassa appicchatā santuṭṭhitā sallekhatā.
dn28:20.2.en: “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing! The Realized One has so few wishes, such contentment, such self-effacement!

dn28:20.5.pli: Acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, tathāgatassa appicchatā santuṭṭhitā sallekhatā.
dn28:20.5.en: It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing! The Realized One has so few wishes, such contentment, such self-effacement!

dn28:20.7.pli: “Passa kho tvaṁ, udāyi, ‘tathāgatassa appicchatā santuṭṭhitā sallekhatā.
dn28:20.7.en: “See, Udāyī, how the Realized One has so few wishes, such contentment, such self-effacement.

dn28:20.10.pli: Passa kho tvaṁ, udāyi, ‘tathāgatassa appicchatā santuṭṭhitā sallekhatā.
dn28:20.10.en: See, Udāyī, how the Realized One has so few wishes, such contentment, such self-effacement.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an5.231:1.5.en: They’re not self-effacing and don’t enjoy self-effacement.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5.231
24. A Resident Mendicant
A Resident Mendicant

an9.1:7.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu yāyaṁ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā santuṭṭhikathā pavivekakathā asaṁsaggakathā vīriyārambhakathā sīlakathā samādhikathā paññākathā vimuttikathā vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā, evarūpiyā kathāya nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an9.1:7.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant gets to take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart, when they want, without trouble or difficulty. That is, talk about fewness of wishes, contentment, seclusion, aloofness, arousing energy, ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.

an9.1:11.2.pli: yāyaṁ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā santuṭṭhikathā pavivekakathā asaṁsaggakathā vīriyārambhakathā sīlakathā samādhikathā paññākathā vimuttikathā vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā, evarūpiyā kathāya nikāmalābhī bhavissati akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an9.1:11.2.en: take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart …

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an5.90:5.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu yāyaṁ kathā ābhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā, seyyathidaṁ—
an5.90:5.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant trainee doesn’t get to take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart, when they want, without trouble or difficulty. That is,

an5.90:10.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant trainee gets to take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart, when they want, without trouble or difficulty. That is,

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5.90
9. Senior Mendicants
A Trainee (2nd)

an9.3:12.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, meghiya, yāyaṁ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā santuṭṭhikathā pavivekakathā asaṁsaggakathā vīriyārambhakathā sīlakathā samādhikathā paññākathā vimuttikathā vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā, evarūpiyā kathāya nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an9.3:12.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant gets to take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart, when they want, without trouble or difficulty. That is, talk about fewness of wishes, contentment, seclusion, aloofness, arousing energy, ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.

an9.3:16.2.pli: ‘yāyaṁ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā …pe… vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā, evarūpiyā kathāya nikāmalābhī bhavissati akicchalābhī akasiralābhī’.
an9.3:16.2.en: take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart …

ud4.1:14.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, meghiya, bhikkhu yāyaṁ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā, santuṭṭhikathā, pavivekakathā, asaṁsaggakathā, vīriyārambhakathā, sīlakathā, samādhikathā, paññākathā, vimuttikathā, vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā; evarūpāya kathāya nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
ud4.1:14.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant gets to take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart and leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment when they want, without trouble or difficulty. That is, talk about fewness of wishes, contentment, seclusion, aloofness, arousing energy, ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.’

ud4.1:18.1.pli: Kalyāṇamittassetaṁ, meghiya, bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkhaṁ kalyāṇasahāyassa kalyāṇasampavaṅkassa yaṁ yāyaṁ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā, santuṭṭhikathā, pavivekakathā, asaṁsaggakathā, vīriyārambhakathā, sīlakathā, samādhikathā, paññākathā, vimuttikathā, vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā; evarūpāya kathāya nikāmalābhī bhavissati akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
ud4.1:18.1.en: A mendicant with good friends, companions, and associates can expect to take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart …

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn122:12.4.pli: Yā ca kho ayaṁ, ānanda, kathā abhisallekhikā cetovinīvaraṇasappāyā ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā santuṭṭhikathā pavivekakathā asaṁsaggakathā vīriyārambhakathā sīlakathā samādhikathā paññākathā vimuttikathā vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā iti: ‘evarūpiṁ kathaṁ kathessāmī’ti.
mn122:12.4.en: ‘But I will take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart and leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment. That is, talk about fewness of wishes, contentment, seclusion, aloofness, arousing energy, ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.’

mn122:20.4.pli: Yā ca kho ayaṁ, ānanda, kathā abhisallekhikā cetovinīvaraṇasappāyā ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā santuṭṭhikathā pavivekakathā asaṁsaggakathā vīriyārambhakathā sīlakathā samādhikathā paññākathā vimuttikathā vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā—evarūpiyā kho, ānanda, kathāya hetu arahati sāvako satthāraṁ anubandhituṁ api paṇujjamāno.
mn122:20.4.en: But a disciple would deem it worthwhile to follow the Teacher, even if sent away, for the sake of talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart and leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment. That is, talk about fewness of wishes, contentment, seclusion, aloofness, arousing energy, ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 122
The Longer Discourse on Emptiness

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an5.181:1.3.pli: Mandattā momūhattā āraññiko hoti, pāpiccho icchāpakato āraññiko hoti, ummādā cittakkhepā āraññiko hoti, vaṇṇitaṁ buddhehi buddhasāvakehīti āraññiko hoti, appicchataṁyeva nissāya santuṭṭhiṁyeva nissāya sallekhaṁyeva nissāya pavivekaṁyeva nissāya idamatthitaṁyeva nissāya āraññiko hoti.
an5.181:1.3.en: A person may be wilderness dweller because of stupidity and folly. Or because of corrupt wishes, being of wishful temperament. Or because of madness and mental disorder. Or because it is praised by the Buddhas and their disciples. Or for the sake of having few wishes, for the sake of contentment, self-effacement, seclusion, and simplicity.

mlDocs.title:

19. Wilderness Dwellers
Wilderness Dwellers

an5.97:1.6.en: They get to take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart, when they want, without trouble or difficulty. That is,

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an5.190:1.3.pli: Mandattā momūhattā pattapiṇḍiko hoti, pāpiccho icchāpakato pattapiṇḍiko hoti, ummādā cittakkhepā pattapiṇḍiko hoti, ‘vaṇṇitaṁ buddhehi buddhasāvakehī’ti pattapiṇḍiko hoti, appicchataṁyeva nissāya santuṭṭhiṁyeva nissāya sallekhaṁyeva nissāya pavivekaṁyeva nissāya idamatthitaṁyeva nissāya pattapiṇḍiko hoti.
an5.190:1.3.en: A person may eat only from the almsbowl because of stupidity and folly. Or because of corrupt wishes, being of wishful temperament. Or because of madness and mental disorder. Or because it is praised by the Buddhas and their disciples. Or for the sake of having few wishes, for the sake of contentment, self-effacement, seclusion, and simplicity.

Those Who Eat Only From the Almsbowl

an10.30:9.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhante, bhagavā yāyaṁ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā santuṭṭhikathā pavivekakathā asaṁsaggakathā vīriyārambhakathā sīlakathā samādhikathā paññākathā vimuttikathā vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā, evarūpāya kathāya nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
an10.30:9.1.en: Furthermore, the Buddha gets to take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart, when he wants, without trouble or difficulty. That is, talk about fewness of wishes, contentment, seclusion, aloofness, arousing energy, ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.
